description: Construction of a pre-fabricated metal building, a concrete pad, and plumbing, mechanical, and electrical infrastructure for a lift station replacement project.
full_summary:
### Tender Notice

#### Title 
Lift Station Replacement Project - Innisfail, AB

#### Solicitation Number
M5000-23-5850/A

#### Notice Type
Invitation to Qualify

#### Tender Status
Expired

Tender Description: This project involves the decommissioning of the current lift station at a government facility located south of Innisfall, Alberta. The contractor will be responsible for removing and disposing of the current lift station equipment, constructing a pre-fabricated metal building, laying a concrete pad, and installing a service pit. The contractor must complete the work by November 30, 2024.

This is a two-phase competition. During the first phase, bidders will be evaluated based on mandatory requirements as outlined in the Request for Qualifications document. The second phase will invite qualified bidders to submit a financial bid based on the specifications and drawings.

Important Details:

* Security requirements apply to this project.
* Canada employs the Integrity Regime in contracting activities, and this requirement is outlined in the attached documents.
* Documents can be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French).
* The Indigenous Procurement policy may apply; details are outlined in the attached notice.

Procurement Details:
* Competitive Bidding Method
* Lowest Price criterion
* Trade Agreement: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Region of Opportunity: Worldwide
* Region of Delivery: Alberta, Canada, and Innisfail

Instructions for Submission:
* Visit the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at http://www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders
* Review solicitation documents for more information
* Submit bids in the required format

Contact Information: Sandra Robinson
Email: [sandra.robinson@rcmp-grc.gc.ca]
Phone: (780) 670-8626
Fax: 780-454-4523

Attachments:
* Details of the project specifications and requirements can be found at the provided URL
* Attachment information for Canadian companies registered with the Indigenous Business Directory is available online.

Note:
* Angola retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement
* Canada is not responsible for information found on third-party websites
* It is the bidder's responsibility to regularly consult GETS for the most up-to-date information.

**Original Translator**
I have translated the text, but it does not entirely conform to the standard/purpose of your request. I tried to modify your text to standardize with similar types of documents that I have translated in the past.
